memberdef.name: IP4_HDR_SZ
memberdef.initializer: 20 /*20 is the minimum, but there may be some options*/

detaileddescription.para:
Tells whether the specified payload type is enabled.
lc
LinphoneCore object.
pt
The LinphonePayloadType we want to know is enabled or not.
TRUE if the payload type is enabled, FALSE if disabled.

Tells whether the specified payload type represents a variable bitrate codec.
lc
LinphoneCore object.
pt
The LinphonePayloadType we want to know
TRUE if the payload type represents a VBR codec, FALSE if disabled.

Enable or disable the use of the specified payload type.
lc
LinphoneCore object.
pt
The LinphonePayloadType to enable or disable. It can be retrieved using linphone_core_find_payload_type
enable
TRUE to enable the payload type, FALSE to disable it.
0 if successful, any other value otherwise.

Set an explicit bitrate (IP bitrate, not codec bitrate) for a given codec, in kbit/s.
lc
the LinphoneCore object
pt
the LinphonePayloadType to modify.
bitrate
the IP bitrate in kbit/s.

Get the bitrate explicitely set with linphone_core_set_payload_type_bitrate().
lc
the LinphoneCore object
pt
the LinphonePayloadType to modify.
bitrate the IP bitrate in kbit/s, or -1 if an error occured.

detaileddescription.para:
Get reason code from the error info.
ei
the error info.
a LinphoneReason

Get textual phrase from the error info. This is the text that is provided by the peer in the protocol (SIP).
ei
the error info.
the error phrase

Provides additional information regarding the failure. With SIP protocol, the "Reason" and "Warning" headers are returned.
ei
the error info.
more details about the failure.

Get the status code from the low level protocol (ex a SIP status code).
ei
the error info.
the status code.
Set the name of the mediastreamer2 filter to be used for rendering video. This is for advanced users of the library, mainly to workaround hardware/driver bugs.
Get the name of the mediastreamer2 filter used for rendering video.
Queue a task into the main loop. The data pointer must remain valid until the task is completed. task_fun must return BELLE_SIP_STOP when job is finished.

Migrate configuration so that all SIP transports are enabled. Versions of linphone < 3.7 did not support using multiple SIP transport simultaneously. This function helps application to migrate the configuration so that all transports are enabled. Existing proxy configuration are added a transport parameter so that they continue using the unique transport that was set previously. This function must be used just after creating the core, before any call to linphone_core_iterate()
lc
the linphone core
1 if migration was done, 0 if not done because unnecessary or already done, -1 in case of error.

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneCore *lc, LinphoneReason reason, LinphoneToneID id, const char *audiofile)
memberdef.name: _linphone_core_set_tone

detaileddescription.para:
Assign an audio file to be played locally upon call failure, for a given reason.
lc
the core
reason
the LinphoneReason representing the failure error code.
audiofile
a wav file to be played when such call failure happens.

Assign an audio file to be played as a specific tone id. This function typically allows to customize telephony tones per country.
lc
the core
id
the tone id
audiofile
a wav file to be played.

Returns a null terminated table of strings containing the file format extension supported for call recording.
core
the core
the supported formats, typically 'wav' and 'mkv'
